page.title: 09CUSTOMS
page.content: to own the others.All newly hatched cygnets are caught and marked with a nick in the beak by the representatives of the three owners who row up the{Thames}between{Sunbury and Pangbourne.Six boats carry men in brightly coloured uniform carrying banners marked with their respective company insignias up the river on a six day journey during which they mark all cygnets with one or two nicks according to the parent swans.Swans with two marks belong to the{Vintners and those with one to the{Dyers. There is great concern for the welfare of the swans at present as many are being poisoned by lead weights used by fishermen.Over the past five to ten years the population of the birds in this country has fallen by about forty percent.
